intro: Cheilanthes eatonii f. castanea, commonly known as the red sandstone fern, is a unique fern species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen rhizome and its ability to thrive in arid and rocky environments. The fronds are typically short and dense, with a leathery texture that helps reduce water loss. This fern is often found growing on limestone or sandstone outcrops, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient plant in Mediterranean and semi-arid climates.
